intro: Riocreuxia flanaganii subsp. segregata, commonly known as the Flanagan's rock fig, is a rare and endemic plant species found in specific regions of southern Africa. It is a shrub characterized by its small, aromatic leaves and distinctive, clustered inflorescences. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are adapted for pollination by specific insect species. Its fruits are fleshy and edible, providing food for local fauna. Due to habitat loss and limited distribution, it is considered a vulnerable species requiring conservation efforts.
